page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: Across the area,there are widely differing styles of housing from the old workers cottages at Kerswell Green,to the large mansion of Pirton Court.We have looked at two very different homes in the area. The Nash dates from 1598 and is a fine example of a Tudor Country Residence.The home consists of three separate half-timbered units partly on a stone base.The Nash has fine brickwork,beautiful tall curving chimneys,and large imposing windows.When we called there was no answer and peering through the windows,it looked as though no one was at present living there. Plovers Rise,was built during 1984 and is the most recent addition to Kempsey.The houses are all brick built on 2 floors with tiled roofs.Each house is gas centrally heated,has a
